page.title: 06BRAUNSTONE FRITH
page.content: { {Braunstone Frith consist of a mixture of private (1/3) and council (2/3) houses built in the 1950/60 period some being flats. A new ring road has removed alot of the through traffic but it has a bus service all week with free to a large Tesco supermarket nearby. Vandalism is negligable ,unemployment aruon 12%.There are few amenities such as a grocer shop,newsagent,Shoemaker public house,a small community centre for the elderly,a playgroup and Coop store. The local infant and junior schools hold keep fit classes and a Brownie pack in the evenings.All of the children over 11 years old go to New Parks Comprehensive School.A popular amenity is the Golf Course but not many locals use it.
